meanings.sent1: The little bird used its pecker to pick up seeds.
meanings.sent2: The colorful parrot's pecker was sharp and strong.
meanings.sent3: The hungry bird's pecker was perfect for eating its favorite fruits.
meanings.sent4: The robin's pecker darted in and out as it searched for worms.
meanings.sent5: The eagle's pecker was a powerful tool for catching fish.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a penis
meanings.sent1: The doctor asked the patient if he had injured his pecker.
meanings.sent2: The comedian made a joke about a man getting his pecker stuck in a zipper.
meanings.sent3: The embarrassed boy blushed when his friends teased him about his pecker.
meanings.sent4: The toddler proudly showed off his pecker to anyone who would look.
meanings.sent5: The old man chuckled at the memory of his younger days when his pecker was more active.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a woodpecker
meanings.sent1: The children watched in awe as the pecker hammered on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The noisy pecker woke up the entire neighborhood with its drumming.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to mimic the pecker's tapping but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The pecker's red head stood out against the green leaves of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The pecker's rhythmic pecking echoed through the woods.

meanings.definition: To strike or pierce with a pointed object
meanings.sent1: He used the hammer to pecker the nail into the wall.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully peckered the fabric with his needle and thread.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to pecker the tough meat to make it tender for the stew.
meanings.sent4: The woodpecker peckered the tree trunk looking for insects.
meanings.sent5: The boxer aimed to pecker his opponent with a swift jab to the ribs.
